page.title: 13Government in rural areas
page.content: This area forms part of the North Cambridgeshire constituency which has historically been conservative, in line with most of rural Cambridgeshire. Local government services are provided by Cambridgeshire County Council who are responsible for road maintenance, street lighting, library and education services and the emergency services, and Huntingdonshire District Council, which is the Housing, Planning and Refuse collection authority. The area covers part of 4 parish councils, namely those of Upwood and the Raveleys, Wistow, Kings Ripton and Broughton. A Parish Council is responsible for providing and maintaining play areas and public lighting where it falls below the highway standard required by the Cambridgeshire County Council.
